summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing the preparation of a 'Sharing Order Part II' related to Jeffrey Epstein's estate. The emails focus on ensuring the order accurately describes trust and will documents received from Epstein's estate attorneys for sharing with other parties.

events.title: Email Correspondence on Sharing Order Draft
events.description: Multiple emails are exchanged among USANYS personnel reviewing and providing feedback on a draft 'Epstein Sharing Order Part II' application.

events.title: Forwarding of Email Chain on Sharing Order
events.description: An email chain discussing the 'Epstein Sharing Order Part II' is forwarded, noting a colleague ('Your BFF') is scheduled on 'Part I all of next week'.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was actively working on a legal 'Sharing Order' related to Jeffrey Epstein's estate in late January 2020.
The order pertained to sharing 'additional trust and will documents' received from Epstein's estate attorneys over the preceding two weeks.
The correspondence shows internal review and drafting efforts to ensure the order accurately characterized the estate materials for sharing.
The document references 'Part I' and 'Part II' of the sharing order process, indicating a multi-stage legal procedure.
